title: UK Stoplight Demo
description: A simple stoplight survey example with default values for UK.

title.es: Please enter your selected personal reference

enumNames: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Virgin Islands of the United States of America

title.es: Please enter the area you live in
Please enter the currency in which you earn your main income
What is your primary economic activity?
Please estimate your gross monthly household income (i.e, before taxes National Insurance contributions or other deductions)
How many people are in your household?
How many people in your household have an income?
How many people under 18 live in your household?
Do you receive any state income. (e.g. benefits, pension, allowances)?
What is your highest educational level?
What is your highest educational level in your household
What is the property title situation of your household?
Is there any member with disabilities in your household? Please indicate the disability type
Please select the geographic location of your household

enum.description: Our household income is always above 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.
Our household income, this year, is above 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.
Our household income is always below 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.

default.description: Our household income is always above 60% of the UK average, i.e., Single: £9,500, couple with no kids: £14,200, couple with two kids: £20,400.

enum.description: Our household income is stable.
Our household income doesn’t change that much.
Our household income always goes up and down and we can’t plan ahead.

default.description: Our household income is stable.

enum.description: In our household everyone has good credit scores; we can borrow money from a bank.
Someone in our household has bad credit scores; borrowing money can be a problem because we don’t know how to get good advice.
In our household we can’t get credit or any proper help to get some; we borrow from loan sharks.

default.description: In our household everyone has good credit scores; we can borrow money from a bank.

enum.description: We save and we can cope with emergencies; we have at least 3 months of expenses set aside. We don’t have a lot of debt.
We have some money to save, but we can’t save too often because debt and bills are hard to cope with.
In our household we don’t have money to save, or for emergencies. We have lots of debt and can’t keep up with our bills.

default.description: We save and we can cope with emergencies; we have at least 3 months of expenses set aside. We don’t have a lot of debt.

description.es: We have more than one source of income

enum.description: In our household more than one person has a job, or the only person who works has a secure job.
In our household only one person has a job, but the income from it isn’t secure. Or, our second-income source is unreliable or comes from benefits.
No one has a job in our household, or our income is not fixed. We rely on benefits.

default.description: In our household more than one person has a job, or the only person who works has a secure job.

enum.description: We all have proper ID. We have things like birth certificates and drivers’ licences to show, if asked.
Someone in our household has ID problems; we can find ways to sort it.
Someone in our household does not have/has a problem with proper ID. We don’t know how to/can’t afford to fix it.

default.description: We all have proper ID. We have things like birth certificates and drivers’ licences to show, if asked.

enum.description: We can rent long-term,   or we own our property. We are happy with our rental contract and can move somewhere else if we want to.
We are unhappy with our current rental contract, or we might have to move. We might not be able to stay in our home because we can’t afford it.
We have slept somewhere that is not our home for one night or more in the last year; or we live in a temporary place; or we fear eviction; or we had to leave our home without wanting to.

default.description: We can rent long-term,   or we own our property. We are happy with our rental contract and can move somewhere else if we want to.

enum.description: In our household our basic appliances work. We have a fridge, freezer, washing machine, cooker, etc.
In our household some basic appliances are faulty or broken.
In our household we can’t often use/don’t have basic appliances.

default.description: In our household our basic appliances work. We have a fridge, freezer, washing machine, cooker, etc.

description.es: We have proper facilities to prepare food

enum.description: We have a proper kitchen with everything to cook and store food for our household.
Our kitchen isn’t bad, but we need to fix things or get more stuff to cook properly.
We do not have a proper place to cook. We have to cook somewhere else or share a crowded space.

default.description: We have a proper kitchen with everything to cook and store food for our household.

enum.description: We can afford to pay for gas and/or electricity all of the time.
We have gas and/or electricity, but we can’t use it all the time because of the cost.
In the past year, sometimes there has been no gas or electricity and we have had to choose between cooking or heating.

default.description: We can afford to pay for gas and/or electricity all of the time.

enum.description: Our house is very safe. There are no broken appliances, structural damage, loose wiring or damp. Doors and windows lock; the building withstands all weather conditions.
Our house has a few safety issues that may be bad for those living there, e.g.: windows let in the cold; risk of flooding.
Our house is in bad condition. People who live there are at risk because of, e.g.: damp or mould, heavy-rain flooding, doors and windows don’t lock properly.

default.description: Our house is very safe. There are no broken appliances, structural damage, loose wiring or damp. Doors and windows lock; the building withstands all weather conditions.

enum.description: In our house we always have access to a bathroom which has got good ventilation, hot- and cold-running water,  privacy and is cleaned often.
In our house we share the bathroom with 4 or more people, and/or the bathroom is not regularly cleaned or is defective.
In our house we do not always have access to a bathroom, and/or our bathroom is in a bad state.

default.description: In our house we always have access to a bathroom which has got good ventilation, hot- and cold-running water,  privacy and is cleaned often.

enum.description: In our house adults, teens and kids do not sleep in the same bedrooms; the house is not overcrowded. Everyone has their privacy.
In our house adults, teens and kids sleep in the same bedrooms; some people in our house want more space or privacy.
In our house many people sleep in the same bedroom. Adults, teens and kids share bedrooms with each other. Our house is overcrowded and we need more space.

default.description: In our house adults, teens and kids do not sleep in the same bedrooms; the house is not overcrowded. Everyone has their privacy.

description.es: We have the furniture we need

enum.description: In our house we have enough space to work and relax in. We have enough furniture and appliances to be comfortable.
Our house is quite comfortable,  but we could do with better furniture and appliances, or the house is too messy to relax in.
We do not have enough furniture or appliances to live comfortably. There is not enough living/eating room or proper facilities to relax with.

default.description: In our house we have enough space to work and relax in. We have enough furniture and appliances to be comfortable.

description.es: We have access to good transportation

enum.description: To get to the places we often go, we have our own transport (car, motorcycle, bicycle); or we have good access to public transport.
To get to the places we go often, transport isn’t always handy, or costs too much. Sometimes we can’t find the money to get about.
We don’t have our own transport and public transport in our area is unreliable, e.g. a bus now-and-then that costs too much.

default.description: To get to the places we often go, we have our own transport (car, motorcycle, bicycle); or we have good access to public transport.

description.es: We can access the shops we need

enum.description: We can always reach the shops and services we need, e.g.: food and hardware shops, hairdressers, banks etc.
Sometimes going shopping is difficult, e.g.: too expensive, shops are far away, carrying heavy bags is a chore, etc.
A lot of the time we can’t go shopping, e.g., shops are far away, too expensive, carrying heavy bags is a chore, etc.

default.description: We can always reach the shops and services we need, e.g.: food and hardware shops, hairdressers, banks etc.

description.es: We have a phone and internet access

enum.description: Adults in our household have affordable mobile phones and internet access.
In our household we have mobile phones and/or the internet, but we can’t always afford them.
In our household we don’t have a mobile phone or the internet.

default.description: Adults in our household have affordable mobile phones and internet access.

description.es: We feel safe where we live and work

enum.description: We feel safe where we live and work.
We don’t feel safe either where we live or where we work.
We don’t feel safe where we work and live.

default.description: We feel safe where we live and work.

description.es: We have the clothing we need

enum.description: In our household everyone has proper clothes and shoes for all conditions/needs e.g. for work.
Our household has enough clothes and shoes, but we don’t always have proper clothing, e.g. work. We have winter clothes, but need more.
In our household we do not have proper clothes or shoes, especially for winter. We often depend on donations.

default.description: In our household everyone has proper clothes and shoes for all conditions/needs e.g. for work.

enum.description: We have good insurance and it covers all possible risks.
We have some insurance, but we aren’t sure if it covers everything, or it doesn’t offer the best protection.
We don’t have proper/any insurance.

default.description: We have good insurance and it covers all possible risks.

enum.description: In our household we always have enough to eat.
In our household we sometimes battle to buy enough food for our needs.
People in our household have had fewer than two meals a day, or have gone hungry in the past few months because we can’t afford food.

default.description: In our household we always have enough to eat.

enum.description: We know what a healthy diet is and we eat healthy food.
We get confused about how to eat healthy or can’t afford to buy healthy food. We aren’t sure if our diet is healthy or not.
We don’t know or think about healthy eating and our diet does not usually include fruit or vegetables.

default.description: We know what a healthy diet is and we eat healthy food.

enum.description: Everyone in the house has a local GP, is registered and uses the service when needed, and is happy with it.
In our household, everyone is registered but not everyone uses the service, even when they should do.
Someone in the household is not registered at a local GP or does not seek medical treatment when needed.

default.description: Everyone in the house has a local GP, is registered and uses the service when needed, and is happy with it.

enum.description: We keep a good, consistent level of hygiene (wash our hands, bathe regularly, brush teeth everyday etc.).
Sometimes we cannot take baths, or not everyone washes their hands or brushes their teeth daily.
Not everyone in our household has   good hygiene. Sometimes we cannot afford to buy basic toiletries (soap, shampoo, toothpaste, toothbrush).

default.description: We keep a good, consistent level of hygiene (wash our hands, bathe regularly, brush teeth everyday etc.).

enum.description: All members of the household are well informed about sexual health and family planning and use contraceptives (condoms, the pill etc.).
Members of the household are informed about sexual health and family planning but take risks. They have access to contraceptives (condoms, the pill etc.) but do not always use them.
Members of the household have little knowledge of sexual health and family planning and do not have access to contraceptives (condoms, the pill etc.).

default.description: All members of the household are well informed about sexual health and family planning and use contraceptives (condoms, the pill etc.).

enum.description: No one in the household has unresolved eye problems and goes to have check-ups at least every 2 years.
A member of the household has not been to an optician in the last 3 years.  They have an eyesight problem but know how to get support.
A member of the household has not visited an optician in more than 5 years but needs to go.  They need glasses but cannot afford them, or don’t know where to go for support.

default.description: No one in the household has unresolved eye problems and goes to have check-ups at least every 2 years.

enum.description: No one in our household has dental problems and everyone visits a dentist regularly. Everyone understands the importance of dental hygiene.
Someone in our household has not been to the dentist in the past 5 years.
In our household, someone has dental problems and cannot or does not know how to access dental care or cannot afford it.

default.description: No one in our household has dental problems and everyone visits a dentist regularly. Everyone understands the importance of dental hygiene.

enum.description: Everyone in our household has all the required vaccinations up to date. We are well informed about the benefits of immunisations.
In our household, we need boosters on some vaccines or we choose not to vaccinate.
In our household, there are people that have not been vaccinated or we don’t know if they have or not.

default.description: Everyone in our household has all the required vaccinations up to date. We are well informed about the benefits of immunisations.

description.es: We dispose of our rubbish well

enum.description: We use the full range of rubbish disposal services including pay-to-collect bulky items. When needed we take items to the neighbourhood recycling centre.
Our household has access to rubbish bins but don’t use them properly. I am not happy with rubbish disposal system and can’t afford to use pay-to-collect for bulky items.
Our household does not have access or does not use a household or communal waste bin. Rubbish is rarely collected in my area.

default.description: We use the full range of rubbish disposal services including pay-to-collect bulky items. When needed we take items to the neighbourhood recycling centre.

description.es: We live in a healthy environment

enum.description: Our neighbourhood is always free of pollution of any kind (e.g. dog dirt, rubbish in the street or bad air quality).
Our neighbourhood is clean most of the time but not always. The air quality is not as good as it should be.
In our household we feel the environment is polluted (e.g. dog dirt, rubbish in the streets, bad air quality). We feel it is a health hazard or it has already affected our health.

default.description: Our neighbourhood is always free of pollution of any kind (e.g. dog dirt, rubbish in the street or bad air quality).

description.es: We know how to read and write

enum.description: Everyone in our household can read and write at appropriate levels in English, including knowledge of writing for work purposes.
Everyone in our household can read and write well, but need help with more complex writing styles or more difficult reading.
Some members of our household do not read and write English at an appropriate level.

default.description: Everyone in our household can read and write at appropriate levels in English, including knowledge of writing for work purposes.

enum.description: All members in our household completed school and all children are on track to obtain their GCSEs. If 16-18 they are either at school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.
Some are at risk of not completing school or not getting a minimum of C in English and Maths GCSEs or not staying in school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.
There are members of our household that should be attending school but they are not. 16-18 year olds are not in school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.

default.description: All members in our household completed school and all children are on track to obtain their GCSEs. If 16-18 they are either at school, college or apprenticeship/traineeship.

title.es: Knowledge and Skills to Generate Income

description.es: We know how to make an income

enum.description: Everyone in our household has the necessary skills to find employment or start their business.
People in our household have some skills needed to find employment but struggle with some aspects (e.g. application forms, interversion skills).
Some adults in our household have no skills to find employment, start their own business, or have never worked.

default.description: Everyone in our household has the necessary skills to find employment or start their business.

enum.description: We have a household budget and stick to it.
We have a household budget but sometimes we overspend.
In our household we find it hard to manage our finances, or we live hand to mouth.

default.description: We have a household budget and stick to it.

enum.description: We have broad social networks that positively influence our lives. We have the confidence to draw on these networks to create opportunities.
We may have broad networks but we don't have the confidence to make the most of them.
In our household, we don’t mix with many people. The people we know have a bad influence on some members of the household.

default.description: We have broad social networks that positively influence our lives. We have the confidence to draw on these networks to create opportunities.

enum.description: In our household, children have all the necessary uniforms, school supplies and additional materials or books to support a good education.
In our household, children have basic uniforms and school supplies. We wish we could afford additional materials and supplies.
In our household, children do not have the required school supplies or they are not sufficient or appropriate.

default.description: In our household, children have all the necessary uniforms, school supplies and additional materials or books to support a good education.

enum.description: We are able to access information via a range of media to suit all of our news and entertainment needs.
We can access information but not always what we need/when we need it, or we have a limited range of media which we prefer to use for entertainment purposes rather than accessing the news.
We have no or very restricted access to media for our news and entertainment.

default.description: We are able to access information via a range of media to suit all of our news and entertainment needs.

enum.description: In our household, we regularly participate in recreational activities in our neighbourhood, as well as activities elsewhere.  We have all the necessary equipment and information to participate, and can afford to do so.
In our household, we sometimes participate in recreational activities but only in our neighbourhood, or we had to quit an activity because we could not afford it anymore.
In our household, we do not participate in recreational activities outside the home.

default.description: In our household, we regularly participate in recreational activities in our neighbourhood, as well as activities elsewhere.  We have all the necessary equipment and information to participate, and can afford to do so.

enum.description: Our household values and recognises cultural traditions and we have a strong feeling of belonging in the community.
Our household seems to belong to the community but we sometimes feel isolated from it.
In our household, we feel no sense of belonging in our local community.

default.description: Our household values and recognises cultural traditions and we have a strong feeling of belonging in the community.

enum.description: Members of our household recognise and value cultural differences and treat everyone the same.
Some members of our household do not tolerate or respect different cultures and treat people negatively if their ideas, religion, race or sexual orientation are different.
Most members of our household do not tolerate or respect different cultures and treat people differently/negatively.

default.description: Members of our household recognise and value cultural differences and treat everyone the same.

enum.description: In our household, we are aware of our rights and feel they are wholly respected.
In our household, most are confident we know our rights but feel like we might be exploited or disrespected.
No-one in our household is clear about our rights. We feel   disrespected and/or exploited.

default.description: In our household, we are aware of our rights and feel they are wholly respected.

description.es: We are part of a group

enum.description: Everyone in our household is actively involved in groups where they can express themselves and feel supported.
Everyone in our household occasionally attends these groups but they do not meet up or attend often and are not well networked in the groups.
There is someone in our household who does not belong to any group (e.g. neighbourhood group, church, committees, parent groups, social groups).

default.description: Everyone in our household is actively involved in groups where they can express themselves and feel supported.

description.es: We know how to petition authorities

enum.description: In our household when we see problems in our community, we know who to talk to (for example going to our local MP or councillors, or organising a petition).
In our household, we do not take action to solve problems in my community.  We only participate if someone else organises it.
In our household, we do not know how to contact local authorities or we think there's no point in getting involved because nothing ever changes.

default.description: In our household when we see problems in our community, we know who to talk to (for example going to our local MP or councillors, or organising a petition).

title.es: Registered to Vote and Votes in Elections

enum.description: Everyone in our household is registered to vote and does so regularly.
Everyone in our household is registered to vote but does not regularly vote.
Members in our household are not registered to vote or we are not motivated to vote in elections.

default.description: Everyone in our household is registered to vote and does so regularly.

title.es: Ability to Solve Problems and Conflicts

enum.description: When we see problems in our community or house, we take action to improve it. Problems are addressed positively and are not avoided.
When we see problems in our household or community, we usually do not do anything about them or are usually unsure of how to solve them.
In our household when we see problems, we usually avoid responsibility or expect others to solve the problem.

default.description: When we see problems in our community or house, we take action to improve it. Problems are addressed positively and are not avoided.

description.es: We have a family life plan

enum.description: In our household, we usually reflect about our present situation, and imagine how it could be different. We have concrete targets for the short, medium and long term and know how to reach them.
In our household, we can imagine where we want to be in the future but are not sure how to get there.
In our household, we can't imagine changing things or think we'd like things to be different, but what's the point?

default.description: In our household, we usually reflect about our present situation, and imagine how it could be different. We have concrete targets for the short, medium and long term and know how to reach them.

description.es: I trust in my abilities and achievements

enum.description: Most or all of the household have strong levels of self-confidence and self-esteem in a variety of situations.
Some but not all of the household have good self esteem or self confidence but in general don’t like being out of their comfort zone.
Most of our household find it difficult to be self-confident and lack self-esteem; we don't enter situations out of our comfort zone.

default.description: Most or all of the household have strong levels of self-confidence and self-esteem in a variety of situations.

enum.description: Our household makes decisions that respect people, the family, and the community.
Our household makes decisions that are heavily influenced by what is accepted in the local neighbourhood.
The household makes decisions that just benefit us. We don’t think about the impact on others.

default.description: Our household makes decisions that respect people, the family, and the community.

enum.description: People in our household can identify their emotions and those of others.  They are able to control their emotional responses in a wide range of situations and understand the consequences of their actions to themselves and others.

People in our household can sometimes identify their emotions or those of others, and control their reactions. Under stress or when facing a problem, they might close-up emotionally or act impulsively.
People in our household do things  without thinking of the consequences to themselves and others.

default.description: People in our household can identify their emotions and those of others.  They are able to control their emotional responses in a wide range of situations and understand the consequences of their actions to themselves and others.

enum.description: Everyone in our household has a good perception of themselves and are self-confident about the way they express themselves. We like to dress well and look good. It is also a habit we value in others.
Some household members admire and/or value people in their way of dressing and appearance but lack the self-confidence to express themselves or feel ashamed when dressed differently.
Most household members do not have a good perception of themselves, or they do not particularly like to dress well or look good, nor is it something they value in others.

default.description: Everyone in our household has a good perception of themselves and are self-confident about the way they express themselves. We like to dress well and look good. It is also a habit we value in others.

title.es: Willingness/Desire to Develop Skills and Knowledge

enum.description: In our household, we are constantly looking to learn or improve our existing skills.
In our household, some are interested in developing new skills and knowledge but do not actively look for these opportunities or think these are accessible to them.
In our household, we are not interested in developing new skills and knowledge.

default.description: In our household, we are constantly looking to learn or improve our existing skills.

description.es: We have no violence in our family

enum.description: Physical, sexual, economic, or emotional abuse is not a problem in our household.
In our household, there have been some instances of physical, sexual, economic, or emotional abuse but they've been addressed.
In our household, there are instances of physical, sexual, economic, or emotional abuse and no action has been taken.

default.description: Physical, sexual, economic, or emotional abuse is not a problem in our household.

enum.description: In our household, we have goals and aspirations and are proactive about achieving them.
In our household, we have some goals and aspirations but sometimes struggle to find means of achieving them.
In our household, we don’t set ourselves goals or have little interest in changing things.

default.description: In our household, we have goals and aspirations and are proactive about achieving them.

description.es: I have control over my life decisions

enum.description: In our household, we are all involved in decision-making processes and have a voice in them. Everyone makes decisions independently in the areas that affect them directly.
Only some members of our household are decision makers and restrict input even when the matter affects someone directly.
In our household, one person makes the decisions and the rest have to live with it.

default.description: In our household, we are all involved in decision-making processes and have a voice in them. Everyone makes decisions independently in the areas that affect them directly.
